isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION - HYDRAULIC RETARDER

svcproc.title: HYDRAULIC RETARDER
svcproc.para: The hydraulic retarder, which is attached to the rear of the transmission, is controlled by the WTEC III controller to slow the vehicle when the retarder request switch is in the on position, cruise control is on, and the ECM requests that the retarder come on to slow the vehicle. The retarder will also activate if the brake pedal is depressed. The retarder will not operate if the transmission output speed drops below 350 rpm. Thus, the retarder slows the vehicle by providing a braking torque at the output of the transmission. The amount of retardation will be reduced if the engine coolant temperature climbs too high to prevent the engine from overheating.
